intro: Cinnamomum doederleinii var. pseudodaphnoides, commonly known as the Chinese cinnamon or Cinnamomum pseudodaphnoides, is a species of flowering plant in the Lauraceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct, aromatic scent. The fruit is a small, dark brown drupe that contains a single seed.
